definition: to chop/to cut down/to throw sth at sb
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs

sentences.english: The men, who included four guards, were injured by rubber bullets and machetes.
sentences.chinese: 包括4名警卫在内的伤者因橡胶弹和大砍刀而受伤。

sentences.english: He hacked open a path with a chopper on the way through the forest.
sentences.chinese: 在穿过森林的路上，他用砍刀开出一条小径。

sentences.english: The women, I noticed, were all clutching machetes.
sentences.chinese: 我注意到所有的女人也都拿着砍刀。

sentences.english: And he had the gun, and he had the machete.
The tree under which we used to take a rest has been cut down.
sentences.chinese: 我们过去常在下面休息的那棵树已砍刀了。

sentences.english: A man single-handedly waved machetes in one hand and a woman, Ye Guo's satchel.
sentences.chinese: 一名男子一手挥着砍刀，一手拽过女子的挎包。

sentences.english: He wore long robes, and golden armor. Terak armed himself with a massive machete.
sentences.chinese: 他身着长袍，披戴金色盔甲，武器是一把巨大的砍刀。

sentences.english: He finds his machete and stands surveying the gloomy forest around him.
sentences.chinese: 他找到他的砍刀，并查看他周围阴暗的森林。

sentences.english: Haiti has a history of violence, with death squads bearing machetes.
sentences.chinese: 海地有着暴力的历史，敢死队都带着大砍刀。

sentences.english: The soldiers hacked at the jungle undergrowth with matchetes.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们用大砍刀乱砍森林中的矮树丛。
